Hello! When it comes to student-friendly and budget-friendly dining options around Beyazıt, you might want to explore some local eateries and street food spots. One great option is to try some traditional Turkish street food like "simit" (sesame bread rings) or "döner" (rotating meat kebabs) from local vendors. Additionally, you can find affordable cafes and small restaurants in the area that offer delicious Turkish dishes like "lahmacun" (Turkish pizza) or "pide" (Turkish flatbread). If you're looking for specific restaurant recommendations, I can also look up some budget-friendly options nearby. Just let me know if you'd like more information!

results.input: Late night food delivery in Şişli
results.response: Istanbul Nightlife Trendy Neighborhoods: Beyoğlu/Galata: - Heart of Istanbul's nightlife - Mix of rooftop bars, clubs, and pubs - Istiklal Street has many options Karaköy: - Hip, artistic area with craft cocktail bars - Great Bosphorus views from rooftop venues - More upscale crowd Beşiktaş: - University area with younger crowd - Good mix of bars and clubs - More affordable options Popular Venues: - 360 Istanbul - Famous rooftop with city views - Mikla - Upscale rooftop restaurant/bar - Kloster - Historic building, great atmosphere - Under - Underground club in Karaköy - Sortie - Upscale club in Maçka - Reina - Famous Bosphorus-side nightclub Rooftop Bars: - Leb-i Derya - Multiple locations, great views - Nu Teras - Sophisticated rooftop in Beyoğlu - Banyan - Asian-inspired rooftop bar - The Marmara Pera - Hotel rooftop with panoramic views Tips: - Most venues open after 9 PM - Dress code: Smart casual to upscale - Credit cards widely accepted - Many venues have entrance fees on weekends - Turkish beer (Efes) and rakı are popular local drinks - Some areas can be crowded on weekends

In Çukurcuma, known for its charming streets and antique shops, you can find cozy cafes offering delightful Turkish breakfast options. While there may not be specific Turkish breakfast-focused restaurants in Çukurcuma, you can explore nearby areas like Beyoğlu for exceptional Turkish breakfast experiences. Places like Karaköy Güllüoğlu or Mavra Café & Bistro in Galata offer delicious Turkish breakfast spreads with a modern twist. Enjoy a variety of cheeses, olives, pastries, jams, and more while soaking in the vibrant Istanbul atmosphere.
